column4: probably getting information to push to Linux's fstab or something.
hard to imaging why looking at boot.ini would help fstab
I'd imagine it's up to them to determine if it's important in the scheme of things.
ahh.. looks like there talking wubi installs..
multiple keyboards on the same PC?
in that case you'll want to search out commands for xrandr or randr ..
when I attempt to install xrandr, it says it's been replaced by x11-xserver-utils.  Does that sound right to you?
no.. randr or xrandr is the system that pretty much controls video now in the backend.. that's why xorg.conf looks so empty.  there are commands to set one monitor right or left of "whatever"
so it's already installed by default.
yes.. but you have to use the terminal to get things done with it.
thanks for that clarification on what server has.  :)
